programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey across Ireland, travelling from Navan to Mullingar. Along the way, he gets up to speed with modern archaeology in County Meath, where he uncovers a controversial Victorian dig at the sacred Hill of Tara. Later, he investigates leaping salmon in Leixslip, and in Mullingar, bangs the drum for the towns traditional marching band

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A look at Wernher von Braun, the gifted young scientist whose ambition led him to abandon any sense of morality in pursuit of his dream of space flight

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitlers personal secretary Martin Bormann and the efforts to track him down. With insufficient evidence to confirm the Nazi officials death, the International Military Tribunal at Nuremberg tried him in absentia during 1946 and eventually sentenced him to death. Despite extensive efforts, he was never found and was eventually presumed to have died in May 1945

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Bowood House in Wiltshire. Among the items being brought in for valuation are a collection of glass ornaments, an 18th-century portrait that children have used for target practice, a carved walking stick, a book documenting the travels of a 19th-century explorer and an account of the sinking of the Titanic by an officer who survived

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two programmes from Bowood House, Wiltshire, and hears the story of a man who went in search of his biological father after finding letters to his mother from an American soldier. The experts examine a box engraved with a secret code, a cigarette case made by a Russian craftsman, a collection of transistor radios and a cartoon based on a news story about an escaped lion that hid in a school

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the last leg of Michael Portillos long journey from Wexford to Westport, a fashionable Victorian seaweed bath is followed by a steamy scene in Ballina. On tenterhooks in Foxford, Michael discovers the visionary charity of an entrepreneurial nun, learns of a double tragedy at Clew Bay and begins a pilgrimage to the summit of Croagh Patrick, Irelands holy mountain

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with a 1936 edition of Bradshaws Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo ventures onto the European rail network, beginning an emotional rail journey which takes him deep into his familys past. In the golden city of Salamanca in northwestern Spain, Michael visits the University to hear of opposition to the fascist takeover of Spain by General Francisco Franco, and gains access to the Generals archive of enemies of the state. Travelling onto the capital city of Madrid, Michael hears how the bombing of a small town in the Basque region in 1937 inspired one of the 20th centurys most shocking works of art, before making his way to the town of Huesca. Michaels final stop is on the border with France at Canfranc station, where he learns of the role the old terminus played in the evacuation of Jews during the Second World War

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1964 Ford Capri Consul coupe comes up for auction. Paul takes a 1957 Leyland Comet truck for a spin, and Dave admits that high on his wish-list is a Citroen 2CV

programme.desc: Investigative journalist Nick Davies receives an anonymous tip-off regarding Rupert Murdochs News of the World. Following the trail, he discovers damning evidence that proves phone hacking at the paper was not the work of one rogue reporter, as has been claimed for years but was endemic. programme.desc: Part two of two. The pressure continues to build on West Yorkshire Police as they step up the hunt for the killer, now being dubbed by the press, the Yorkshire Ripper. On top of the crimes that police decide to include in the Ripper investigation, murders and attempted murders with a clear link to the killer are discarded and left unsolved. programme.title: I Fought the Law: The Ann Ming Story
programme.desc: How Ann Ming, the grieving mother of Julie Hogg who was murdered in 1989, fought for 17 years to change Englands 800-year-old double jeopardy law to ensure her daughters killer was brought to justice. Plus, how her fight paved the way for other landmark convictions including Stephen Lawrences killers. Narrated by Sheridan Smith

programme.title: Irelands Unidentified Bodies
programme.desc: Rose Coady and her daughters provide DNA samples to be compared against bones that have been found in the Wexford area, in the hope that if they are her son Patricks remains, they will be returned to her family. Plus, Denis Walshs parents received the devastating news that their son, missing for 25 years, has been identified

programme.title: Worlds Greatest Hotels

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: My Unique BandB

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A blackmailer contaminates a jar of baby food in a local supermarket and promises it will not be the last if he does not receive payment. Wycliffe and his team spring into action, aware they are under investigation by the police disciplinary squad. Crime drama, starring Jack Shepherd and Sharon Duce

programme.title: Storage Hoarders

programme.title: Mountain Vets
programme.desc: Jennie heads to a friends farm where a young calf has developed a serious limp. The calfs protective mother is making it clear she wants her baby back, and Jennie does not want to distress her, so has to work fast. Vet Darren treats a two-day-old lamb, whose owner thinks has a urinary infection. However, when she happily relieves herself all over Darrens examination table, he has to use all his investigative skills to diagnose the real problem. Maurice King, the founder of the Downe Veterinary Clinic, encounters a loggerhead turtle has been rescued by the local sea life sanctuary

programme.title: Mountain Vets
programme.desc: Nuala spends the morning pregnancy-testing the livestock on her family farm, where her father and brother tend 200 dairy cows. Jennie attends Minnie the Jack Russell, who has delivered one of her pups, with more still to come. However, Minnies labour has slowed dangerously and Jennie has to act fast if she is to save the lives of the rest of the litter - leading to a difficult decision for owner Jamie. Meanwhile, an emergency case leaves Darren delivering two sets of twins

programme.title: John and Lisas Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Lisa Faulkner and John Torode present recipes ideal for those in a hurry, including sausage and sourdough bake, spaghetti carbonara, a root vegetable and feta tray bake and strawberry and almond pudding. Joining the couple are MasterChef winners Dhruv Baker and Shelina Permalloo, who serve up chilli and lime chicken and a Mauritian curry

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King are in Northumberland, enjoying its stunning coastline and rugged landscapes. The duo visit Hjem, a Michelin-starred restaurant located within the Hadrian Hotel and run by Scandinavian-born chef Alex and his partner Ally, whos front of house. Its the Bikers job to help Alex and Ally connect with new, local producers, ones that can inspire award-winning cuisine

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A crime wave hits Ashfordly train station as a number of freight wagons mysteriously vanish, giving the police a tricky case to crack, but a sandwich could provide a vital clue. Rural drama, starring Gwen Taylor, Jonathan Kerrigan and Sophie Ward

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A teenage boy is brought into the Royal having fallen from a cliff, but it soon emerges that the incident was a suicide attempt as evidence of extreme depression comes to the surface. Dr Cheriton contacts the youngsters psychiatrist, but is taken aback when electroshock therapy is suggested as a form of treatment, so ventures to the family home to recommend an alternative - only for tragedy to strike. Meanwhile, a hypochondriac causes chaos at the hospital when she insists her dog be treated following a snake bite, and a heart-to-heart talk between Drs Weatherill and Ormerod leads to a passionate kiss. Honor Blackman guest stars

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Jack is asked to investigate the theft of a car belonging to a friend of Mullett, but misjudges the grizzled Superintendents capacity for tact and diplomacy and it is not long before he is taken off the case. Things take a shocking turn when the car finally turns up - with the body of a drug dealer in the boot. Detective drama, starring David Jason, with Melanie Thaw and Bruce Alexander

programme.title: Heartbeat

Helen tries to tell Rob she doesnt want a relationship with him, but worries about hurting his feelings. Meanwhile, Oscar catches Peggy and David hosting a poker tournament in the Aidensfield Arms and bars them from the pub. Rural drama starring Sophie Ward, Derek Fowlds, Gwen Taylor and David Lonsdale

programme.title: The Bletchley Circle
programme.desc: Susan and her code-breaking allies seem to have finally tracked down the murderer, and attempt to confront the culprit. However, the pursuit of justice remains complicated - and as the women get closer to their target, they are forced to put themselves in grave danger. Drama set in 1952, starring Anna Maxwell Martin, Rachael Stirling, Julie Graham and Sophie Rundle

Adding to his stress, DI Cole and DS Jackson from the MIT arrive and begin picking holes in his investigation. Stunned that a search of Malones farmhouse has not been carried out, Cole and Jackson conduct their own. However, when they arrive, Malone is nowhere to be seen

programme.title: Death Row: Countdown to Execution
programme.desc: Susanna Reid travels to Huntsville, home of the most active death chamber in the United States, to come face to face with Death Row inmate Patrick Murphy - one of the seven members of the notorious Texas 7 gang - who violently murdered a police officer while on the run. Susanna meets the lawyers who are fighting for and against his execution, the family of the victim who lost his life, as well as Patricks own family and, when his execution day arrives, is outside the death chamber with those closest to the crime

Nostalgic rural drama, guest starring Robert Glenister and Celia Imrie

If it fails, he will be the oldest man put to death in Texas for more than 100 years. programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Liam Neeson and Micheal Richardson, who are playing father and son in comedy-drama Made in Italy. Breakout star of The Serpent, Tahar Rahim, talks about his gripping new legal drama The Mauritanian, while Cush Jumbo reflects on five-part thriller The Beast Must Die, in which he stars. Comedian and actor Rob Brydon and the undisputed queen of Dragons Den Deborah Meaden also feature. With music by singer-songwriter Laura Mvula

programme.title: The Group Chat
programme.desc: Richard Chambers, Gavan Reilly and Zara King sit down together and discuss the main news stories of the week and the behind the scenes of the job in an extended round-table conversation

programme.title: Below Deck: Mediterranean
programme.desc: Ben is determined to regain his sea legs, but Siroccos faulty galley has other plans. Travis latest drunken night has Sandy at the end of her rope
